job.hired_speech: So, you want to help us make butt loads of cash by dishing out heart disease to our unsuspecting customers? Okay, you're hired.
job.not_eligible_speech: Why don't you ask a homeless guy if can hold his change cup? We've got low standards, but you don't meet 'em.
job.no_promotion_speech:
You're hardly 'Employee of the Month' material. Ask again when you've put in more time.
(McStick's Employee: Promotions are based on work experience)
job.promotion_speech: I guess you've proven yourself worthy of a promotion - don't make me regret my decision.

random_event.description: While making fries, you managed to splash fryer oil all over the place, and even burnt your hand a little. Rookie mistake, kid.
You forgot to bring your hairnet to work today. Now, that is just plain careless, missy.
While running across the kitchen, you slipped on a hamburger bun and hit the ground pretty hard. Luckily, you only have minor internal bleeding.
A lady asked for 'no pickles' and you heard 'extra pickles'. You got yelled at... big time. (Somebody's getting spit on their burger next time they come in).
While unloading the grocery order, you managed to throw your back out -- and the manager gave you a bonus for it! ...as long as you keep your mouth shut, that is.
A coworker dared you to shoot a packet of hot sauce up your nose. Yeah, it burned like a mother trucker, but at least you gained the respect of your colleagues. Well, some of them.
You broke up a food fight in the dining room. Way to keep the peace, chief; you have ketchup and special sauce all over you.
You helped an old lady carry four huge bags of burgers outside. Good deeds make you feel... good.
The manager commented on how clean your uniform is looking. Everyone loves a neat and tidy employee.
You learned how to work the cash register today, aaand how to make change from a $5 bill -- score!
The corporate office loves your new burger concept, the 'Curried Cow and Carrot Ciabatta'. The new C4 Burger is sure to be 'The Bomb' this summer.
Yes! You finally won "Employee of the month!" They kept telling you that you weren't EOTM material, but you showed them!

A masked gunman busted through the front door and slipped on the wet floor you just mopped! Good thing you forgot to put down the 'Caution: Wet Floor' sign. You are awarded a bonus for your bravery... and your total disregard for public safety.
It was so slow today that you decided curling a 20lb bottle of special sauce all shift was a good way to battle boredom. Oohyea, feelin' the burn.
The owner stopped by personally to tell you how much he appreciates your dedication and work ethic. You must be doing something right.

rank.desc: You flipped burgers all day long. Yay.
Another grease filled nightmare.
You fried fries like a champ.
Another Day, another dollar.
Shake Shake Shake...SHAKE SHAKE SHAKE!
You successfully mixed the mayo, thousand island, and ketchup together.
What a major pain in the ass. You need a better job.
You worked a full shift and got paid.
You worked drive-through. It sucked.
You watched over all the lackeys.

job.hired_speech: "So, you ready to work for 'The Man'? Give it 110% and 30 years... and you could BE that man. High five! Welcome aboard.
job.not_eligible_speech:
"Wow, we hire almost anyone, but you... you sir are a few fruits short of a basket. Or something like that, anyways."
(Corporate Zombie: Requires 25 Intelligence)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"Company policy prevents your position advancement at this time. Oh yeah, and this internal report says you aren't smart enough, either."
(Corporate Zombie: Requires Intelligence for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "We here at New Lines Incorporated wish you a safe and, above all, productive time in your new position."

random_event.description: You smashed your hand in the photocopier again. Jeez, how does that keep happening?
You were caught playing a flash game at work, and your boss gave you a lecture. Luckily, it only resulted in a warning - Gotta be stealthy about it!
Your boss asked you to work on Saturday. You told him where to go, and gave him pretty specific directions on how to get there.
You weren't invited on the company golf trip today... *sniff*
You arrived at work to find your desk completely covered in silly string. It took most of your day just to clean it off. Good one... jerks.
You spent the entire day reading professional publications and documents. You honestly had nothing better to do.
You spent the day chatting with friends on a social networking site, accomplishing absolutely nothing work related.
During today's fire drill, you were first to the muster point. If you aren't first, you're last!
Company wide bonuses went out today for having the best year on record! Time to pick up that new matching cardigan set you've been day-dreaming about, you corporate schmuck.
You brought in donuts for the office this morning. Smooth move; everyone pretended to like you for the day.
The owner's super-hot daughter keeps staring at you. You feel flattered, but there's no way you can talk to her without losing your job. And your manhood.
Being the last one in the office, you decide to flip all the furniture upside-down for a good laugh. Everyone will be super pissed - good thing they won't know it was you, suckers!
Your business proposal went swimmingly -- one of the big wigs even commented on your professionalism!
The company has given you a stake in shareholder equity. You pretty much own the place now... well, at least the desk lamps and paperweights.

rank.desc: Sorting mail makes you feel important.
Another office day grind.
You spent the day on the phone 'cold calling'. You didn't actually sell anything.
You worked on an important report with a bunch of numbers and stuff.
Another day, another dollar.
You worked. You got paid.
Another day taking orders from the president.
Another day running &%$#. It's good to be in charge.
You watched football in your office.
Sat in the master office all day, going over the master plans.

job.hired_speech: "Welcome to the team! Let's make some games."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"I'm not sure you're 'XGen' material. Come back when you have a bit more experience."
(Video Game Designer: Requires 40 Intelligence and 20 Charm)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"No. Nice try though."
(Video Game Designer: Requires Intelligence and Charm for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "Alright, I guess you've earned it... you have the stats, anyhow."

random_event.description: Your artist tells you he can't make the casino mini games look the way you want them to. Damn artists.
You spent your entire shift playing a one-button game. You feel slightly dumber.
You burnt a massive pile of Parmesan cheese in the company toaster oven. The building smells like death, and everyone hates you.
You had to renew a software license today. Your coin has been affected.
Out at lunch today, everyone put a credit card in a hat and let the waitress pick one. Yours was the not so lucky winner.
You stay late working on dialogue for your new RPG. At one point, you even write *about* writing dialogue in a video game. It's pretty lame... but at least it's finished.
You spent the day reading detailed tutorials on the latest physics engine techniques. It's informative stuff, but it takes its toll on you... physically.
Your new multi-player game is a big hit with the over 80 crowd. "Tower Defense Bingo" is ready for console launch!
You brought in donuts for the office this morning. Everyone loves donuts... especially game developers!
A foam dart gunfight broke out in the office and you got hit in the eye. Everyone in the office thought it was funny, even though you couldn't see out of one eye all day.
You stay in late to play some video games with coworkers. You got dominated, but it was a pretty awesome time.

The new 'game function' you coded broke again... and this time you lost it! Nerd rage took over and you smashed your monitor on the ground while everyone silently watched in terror. One guy even pooped a little.
You spent the entire day playing "Guitar Zero" at the office. Productivity may have been at an all time low, but your mad skillz were at an all-time high -- Everyone watched in awe.
Your new game, "Super Time Traveller Advance 8 – The Alien Saga", was voted best "Match 3" game of all time by PC Lamer.

rank.desc: You did what people asked all day.
You played the same game for hours in a row testing features. You now hate that game.
You spent your time making pixel art.
Coded 1000 lines of code. Making progress.
You drew pretty pictures all shift.
You worked on a complex jumping puzzle. Does anyone actually like jumping puzzles?
Coded 10,000 lines of code. You're a super freak, super freak!
Professionally produced projects for programming prodigy programmers.
You wowed the team with your design genius.
You are daring, eccentric, and brilliant. You can do whatever the &%$# you want in this company.

job.apply_text: "Yeah yeah, I wanna be a rock star."
job.hired_speech: "Okay Kid, I'll manage you. Let's start you out with some easy gigs -- they don't pay much, but at least it's experience."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"Sorry rookie, but The Grand Trump don't teach just anyone."
(Rock Star: Requires 110 Strength and 180 Charm and a Guitar)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"In this business you need 3 things; charm, strength, and lots of smokin' hot groupies! You better improve on at least 2 of the 3 if you want to rake in the big bucks."
(Rock Star: Requires Strength and Charm for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "You've been killing on stage! Sure, I'll score you some bigger venues... if you think you can handle it."

random_event.description: Apparently, cops in Salt Lake City frown upon public nudity. Your sock didn't count.
Your van broke down on the way to a gig, and you missed the show. Bummer.
The sound guy told you to turn down your amps. You told him to turn down the suck. Worst. Comeback. Ever.
You incited a riot at an outdoor festival. Everyone was stoked... except for the cops who cuffed you and read you your rights.
You climbed the speaker stack and jumped 40 feet into the crowd, but everyone moved out of the way. That's gotta hurt.
Someone was trampled to death in your massive mosh-pit. You're not allowed back in Canada anymore.
You rocked so hard that one guy puked just from the sound waves... or from all that beer. But still, it was pretty awesome.
One of your amps caught on fire and the hall was evacuated... true story!
You threw a bloody goat-head into the audience, and PETA launched a campaign against you. Album sales tripled -- Cha-Ching!
One of your songs was licensed for the upcoming videogame "Guitar Sherpa". How many more of these things can they make, anyways?

In a flash of brilliance, you turn your amp up to 11 - the audience goes ape-$^!%, climbing the gate and throwing women's underwear onstage. You have to sneak out the back door to avoid being mobbed by fans.
Your band was filmed as the subject of cult Rockumentary, "This is Vertebra Tap".
You got in a fist-fight with a heckler, then climbed back on stage and finished your set while you bled profusely. Rock 'n Roll, baby.
Your new album went gold. All aboard the money train! Toooot Toot!

rank.desc: Rock and ROOOOOLLLLLL!!!!
You rocked out on stage, hardcore!
You aced that set!
They screamed for an encore. You didn't disappoint.
An out of town show -- went pretty well.
You worked on your new album in the studio.
Another day, another groupie.
You raised the roof!
The Japanese girls won't leave you alone.
Lights, blood, pyrotechnics, and ladies underwear. You stunned and amazed the crowd, as usual.

job.apply_text: "I got mad skills, I want sponsorship."
job.hired_speech: "Alright kid, I'll give you a shot. Let me know when you're ready to make some real cashish."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"Sponsorship? No way, broheem. Let me be blunt - you have no style. It's all about the execution, son -- you got to make it look good!"
(Pro Skateboarder: Requires 40 Charm)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"Mo' cheddar? Put in mo' time."
(Pro Skateboarder: Requires Charm for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "My crew tells me you're ready to step it up a notch -- don't let me down."

random_event.description: You were caught skating in a 'no skate' zone. The security guard was pretty mean about it.
You missed a rail. Your future children may have been affected.
You fell on your head trying to grind a picnic table. For some reason, probably unrelated, you can't remember where you live.
You tried to ollie a parked car... good thing it was an ambulance.
You busted a sick 540-heel flip, but broke your board on the landing. Aww, muffin... at least you were okay, right?
You came up with a sick new grab trick -- it blew everyone's mind when you landed it perfectly on the first try.
You tore up the skate park today, leaving onlookers catatonic. One kid said you had hollow bones.
You met a group of hot skater chicks at the park. You even scored a number, dawg!
While shooting a new video, you landed a crazy 720 Japan air. The Japanese are going to LOVE it.
You scored a Rad Bull sponsorship deal, including a free lifetime supply. Welcome to the world of controversial energy beverages!
You pulled a crazy Natas spin; people were calling you Mr. Natas all day.
You spent the day breaking down footage of your latest video. The time paid off -- you saw a couple things you could do better.
An underground skateboard magazine declared you 'Boarder of the year'. Look at you, baller.
You placed 1st in the vert competition. Big air means big money.

rank.desc: Another day at the park.
You spent the day hitting up different parts of the city.
Another day, another ollie.
You busted rails at the park, impressing onlookers.
You demonstrated half-pipe dominance.
Another day at the park.
You aced a sick grind.
You showed off some manual tricks and grabs.
You worked on your new shoe design.
You blessed the skate park with your greatness.

job.hired_speech: "Welcome to the crew! Saddle up and come talk to me when your ready to paint the town red. And green and purple."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"You lack that certain swagger we're looking for."
(Graffiti Artist: Requires 35 Charm)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"You're good, but you're not THAT good."
(Graffiti Artist: Requires Charm for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "Think you've got the skills to pay the bills? Alright, I guess you've earned it."

random_event.description: While tagging a wall for the 'West Side' gang, you carelessly wrote 'West Tide'. How does that happen? What's a west tide?
You were caught red-handed by the po-po. Jail, yo.
You accidentally stomped on a paint can. Both the can and part of your foot exploded in the process -- it's just a flesh wound.
You went out and bought a few fancy new colors. Had to get the good kind, didn't you?
The crew decided they needed a night off and racked up a bill at the casino... well, that was fun.
You tagged the back of an apartment with an offensive word. Tisk tisk, that's not very nice.
Tonight was your night to carry all the gear. Burn baby, burn.
You created an entirely original piece of art unlike anything the world has seen before. Everyone loved it... too bad it was on a napkin at McStick's.
While keeping six, you spotted 5-0 just in time for your crew to abort mission and scatter. Phew - that was close!
The graffiti guerrilla marketing campaign you did for "Punktuations" new line street clothing went over so well that they gave you a bonus. Snice!
One of the cheerleaders from the U of SA got you to body paint her for the big game. That was... epic win.
While you were pumping out a sick burner, a city cleaner stopped by to sincerely thank you for all the work.
You invented a new spray gun that won't get your fingers wet; the crew thinks you're a genius!
The new 'Professor Who?' was in need of some serious street cred. He got you to tag pretty much everything, including the police station... ballzy.
XGen Studios asked if you could come by and spray their logo on one of the office walls; they were super stoked with how it turned out.

rank.desc: You vandalized a building with a lame graphic.
You wrote on a bathroom door with a marker.
You stenciled the side of a building.
Another day, another tag.
You sprayed while you prayed that you wouldn't get caught.
You sprayed a train car with pretty sweet looking burner.
You got paint on your clothes... but not in your mouth. Smooth.
You touched up your sick mural from the other night.
You tagged a wall with an impressive original design.
The 'Infamous Artist' strikes again!

job.hired_speech: "Done. You ready to make bank?"
job.not_eligible_speech:
"You wouldn't be able to stomach this job, kid. Trust me."
(Hitman: Requires 180 Strength and Negative Karma)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"You think you can just whack a few guys and move up the ladder? Nah kid, it don't work like that."
(Hitman: Requires Strength and Negative Karma for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "Let's keep this between us, capiche? You're doing swell kid -- keep it up."

random_event.description: Your target got away. How very disappointing.
You found your target, but he was dead when you got there. Somebody beat you to the job.
Your target had a police escort, but you took the shot anyways... and missed. Looks like you're going away for awhile.
You didn't 'clean up' very well after that last job. You can sit and think about how it all went wrong... in jail.
You got pinched by an undercover agent. You really can't trust anyone. Especially... in jail.
You spent the day combat training; staying in shape is always a good idea.
Your 'Assassination Robot Kit' finally came in the mail! (Some assembly required.)
You whacked two guys in one night -- Now THAT's productivity!
You took care of your target, as well as both of his cronies. That's worth a little something extra.
You were sent to do an out of town job. It went smoothly -- you even got paid travel expenses!
You sent roses to a target's funeral. Whatever helps you sleep at night.
'Hardcore Hitman' nominated you for 'best dressed' this year. Way to look sharp!
You cleaned out a house full of rival hitmen. No one likes competition.
You got a bonus for dealing with one of Vinnie's brother-in-laws -- Now go have some fun.

rank.desc: You picked him off real good.
Whacked.
Target Eliminated.
Boom! Headshot!
You made quick work of him.
Another day, another dead guy.
You cleaned up someone else's mess.
You ninja'd your target to death.
You blew him away from 1000 paces.
Vinnie gave you a high profile target; another clean kill.

job.hired_speech: "Welcome to The Force. Do us all proud."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"Sorry, but I can tell from looking at you that you won't pass the physical portion of the exam. You better hit the gym first."
(Police Officer: Requires 75 Strength and Positive Karma)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"The city budget won't allow it right now."
(Police Officer: Requires Strength and Positive Karma for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "Don't let this go to your head."

random_event.description: You spent the entire shift patrolling Donut World. 12 double chocolates and one raspberry filled were killed as a result.
You slept in the squad car all shift. Way to keep the city safe.
You filled out a speeding ticket but misprinted the amount. $1.54 isn't going to deter people from speeding.
You flipped on the cherries just to go through a red light. No one likes a cop that does that.
You caught a bunch of punks spray-painting an office building. Most of them scattered off, but at least you grabbed one guy.
You won the weekly headshot pool during shooting practice. Nice shootin', Ace.
The chief finally gave you your overtime bonus. Pfft... took long enough.
You spent the day doing boring paperwork. Staying awake wasn't easy.
You caught a guy peddling drugs at the dance bar; way to keep the streets clean.
You aced your annual fitness test -- Go you!
You gave a talk to some kids at a local elementary school about bullying, but they all just wanted to hold your gun.
Through an anonymous tip you found a stash of drugs in the old abandoned warehouse. You are truly a hero of the people.
You caught a cyber criminal mastermind in an elaborate pyramid scheme. You feel like a genius.
You scored the take-down on an armed bank robber. Everyone was impressed with how you manhandled him.

rank.desc: You checked meters all day.
You kept the streets safe.
Wrote out speeding tickets all day.
Investigated a domestic disturbance.
You assigned patrol duties for the day.
You spent the day trying to establish connections to the underground.
You polished and cleaned your rifle all day.
Another day, another dollar.
Sat in the office all day.
You did very little.

job.apply_text: "I always wanted to be a Milkman."
job.hired_speech: "Yes! You're hired. With my brains and your delivery skills, we can make this milk the number one drink in the world! Bwhahahaha! Just one rule - No 'got milk' jokes."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"I'm looking for someone with a little more muscle. This job is pretty physical."
(Milkman: Requires 15 Strength)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"You're kidding, right? Your noodly arms couldn't handle it."
(Milkman: Requires Strength for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "You do quality work, no matter what other people say. Let's keep the moo juice flowing!"

random_event.description: You dropped a case of milk down the stairs. It's a bona-fide, pasteurized, homogenized nightmare.
A vicious looking dog was blocking the way, so you decided to throw a bottle of milk through an open window. It didn't turn out as well as you'd hoped.
Your milk delivery was late, leaving one costumer's cereal dry and bare. Some people take their cereal pretty seriously -- he reamed you out hardcore.
Sales are affected as mad cow once again hits the industry. All attempts to make them laugh have failed... so far.
You kicked open a rusty gate and broke it. You feel like the juggernaut, but you still have to pay for the gate.
Today you figured out an alternate delivery route that saves you time. And time... is money.
While making a routine delivery, a middle-aged lady in a bathrobe asked you to come in for a drink. You still can't believe you turned her down.
You just scored a new milk deal with a restaurant chain -- That's worth something.
You got all your deliveries done in record time. Way to go, champ!
Your genius marketing campaign took off like wildfire! 'Just milk it' sells itself.
You made the cover of 'Milk Monthly' -- They even got your good side in the photo!
You saved a burning school bus by throwing bottles of milk at it. All the kids want to be a hero like you when they grow up, even the kid you hit in the head with a bottle of milk.
You came up with a new formula for the ultimate milk - white chocolate! The industry will never be the same again.
A crazy cat lady needed a crazy amount of milk today. What a score!

rank.desc: 'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
'Nother day, 'nother liter.
You done good today.

job.apply_text: "I'm looking for work, as a matter of fact."
job.hired_speech: "Don't disappoint me."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"Beat punk, I need someone way more badass."
(Drug Dealer: Requires 75 Intelligence, 60 Strength, and Negative Karma)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"No."
(Drug Dealer: Requires Intelligence, Strength, and Negative Karma for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "These guys, always wanting more... alright, you got a deal."

random_event.description: You were busted pedalling at the club. You goin' to jail, dawg.
A rival drug lord set you up big time. Stash seized, jail imminent.
You dropped your stash in the gutter, right down the drain. Sewer people rejoice. You cry.
It was a slow day, so you decided to sample some of the merchandise. 2 large pizzas quickly followed.
You went to one house for a quick drop off, but ended up playing 'Super Street Wiper' all night on an old Super ANY-S. Great game, but not very productive.
You shorted a customer half an ounce -- He didn't even notice.
Some Junky tried to jump you, but you made an example out of him.
U of SA graduation party plans involved you in a big way.
A bachelor party paid a premium for your services.
You spent the day in at the university waiting for someone. You look smart, so you feel smart.
A big concert in town made you a very popular person. It's nice to feel wanted.
Some nut-job took a swing at you on a delivery run.
One of your regulars didn't pay his tab, so you paid it for him. With his face.
The Grand Trump and his groupies hung out with you all night... and you guys had fun. Bad thing was, they never paid for anything.
You scored a huge deal with a guy in the South. You made a nice piece of commish.

rank.desc: You worked the streets.
Wheeling and dealing.
You sold drugs. Shame on you.
Another day, another ounce.
You did yo thing.
Run Drug Runner! RUN!
You flipped your stash for cash.
You ensured the cargo arrived safely.
You ran the streets all night.
You watched over your empire.

job.apply_text: "Okay Morpheus, show me how it's done."
job.hired_speech: "You got gall, my friend. Now - let me show you how to 'take advantage' online."
job.not_eligible_speech:
"You gotta' be willing to break the rules, friend."
(Hacker: Requires 60 Intelligence, Negative Karma and a Crackbook)
job.no_promotion_speech:
"Go get some intelligence. Until then, I can share no more secrets."
(Hacker: Requires Intelligence and Negative Karma for promotions)
job.promotion_speech: "I guess you're ready to learn more advanced techniques."

random_event.description: You installed a trainer for a popular flash game, thinking you were all cool and stuff. The problem is you also installed a Trojan, and your bank account information was stolen. Serves you right, n00b!
Your online pyramid scheme fell through, and you're going to jail. Just tell them you're a hacker and you'll gain instant credibility on 'the inside'.
You were flamed on the hacker forums. Epeen shrunk as a result.
You stubbed your toe on the desk, a fate worse than death. Okay, maybe not... but still, don't you hate that?
You were caught using a stolen credit card number online. You are going to jail.
You brute-force cracked an authentication server, shutting down a popular social networking site. Your hacker brethren are amused at your anti-social display.
You downloaded the E-book "Buff N' Stuff – Guide to Musclyness". You feel stronger just by downloading it.
You met a hot girl in a chat room. No idea how hot, but with a name like Hotgirl45 you're picturing 'really' hot.
You pirated a copy of "Typing Teacher Elite 97". You can feel the difference in your keystrokes!
You got bored and created the next successful free music-sharing network. The RIAA is not amused.
You made a hack-pack for an online flash game. Too bad everyone that used it just got teh ban hammer.
Using an online dating site, you conned a wealthy old Welsh woman into sending you money to feed your staving pet grizzly bear. Some people will believe anything.
You spearheaded an attack on a major corporation, resulting in millions of dollars in lost revenue. Other hackers think 'you da' man'.
Hacking into the University's computer, you credit yourself with a Masters Degree in Philosophy. You feel smarter, philosophically speaking.

rank.desc: You guessed passwords all day. You're such a n00b.
You ran someone else's gold-farming script for awhile.
A few gullible suckers responded to your phony online payment E-mail with their account details.
Your key logger captured credit card numbers, bank account information, and personal details.
You found a hole in a corporate firewall and sold it to them for a reasonable price.
You hacked in and stole corporate information for an anonymous client.
Your sold the services of your botnet to the highest bidder.
You exploited vital online information.
Your team of hackers planted information in a military database and blackmailed the depart of defense.
You funnelled national treasury into your personal Swiss bank account.

job.hired_speech: Welcome to the gym. Click 'work' to workout.
job.not_eligible_speech: Why don't you ask a homeless guy if can hold his change cup? We've got low standards, but you don't meet 'em.
job.no_promotion_speech: There are no promotions, you're at the gym n00b.
job.promotion_speech: I guess you've proven yourself enough for a promotion. Don't make me regret my decision.

random_event.description: You felt the burn.
You worked out.
Another fine workout.
You pushed it to the max!
You took it to the next level!
You pumped some iron. Look at you, iron man.
You tried circuit training today after reading about it in an exercise book. Well ladi-da, Mr. fancy pants.
Some guy cut in on your weights between sets without asking, so you reminded him of his manners. With your fists.
You loaded up on protein shakes after your workout today; you feel bigger already!
Some dude offered you steroids today, so you lied and told him you already had a supplier. Way to protect your street cred!
You dropped a weight on your toe, but kept working out for another half hour to prove you were OK. At least your pride isn't shattered as badly as your foot.
A hot girl in spandex walked by and smiled at you while you were pumping iron. Maybe you can pick her up later in spin class.
Power lifting class. You feel shredded.
Yoga class. Stats improved substantially.

job.hired_speech: Welcome to the U of SA.
job.not_eligible_speech: Why don't you ask a homeless guy if can hold his change cup? We've got low standards, but you don't meet 'em.
job.no_promotion_speech: There are no promotions, you're at school n00b.
job.promotion_speech: I guess you've proven yourself enough for a promotion. Don't make me regret my decision.

random_event.description: You fought off a pirate-zombie invasion with your ninja skills during calculus. Well, you dreamed you did, anyhow... wait, what's a 'differential'?
One plus one equals a window was NOT the correct answer. You failed your quiz, funny guy.
You studied really hard.
You crammed hardcore.
You bought a stolen answer sheet from a classmate before the exam. You're oooonly cheating yourself... and the test, on which you got 100%.
You picked up a copy of 'Rocket Science for Dummies' before the the lecture; this stuff isn't so hard after all!
You looked like a genius, answering every question the professor asked in class.

The most epic night of drinking ever! Followed by the most epic headache ever...

job.hired_speech: Welcome to the gym. Click 'work' to workout.
job.not_eligible_speech: Why don't you ask a homeless guy if can hold his change cup? We've got low standards, but you don't meet 'em.
job.no_promotion_speech: There are no promotions, you're at the gym n00b.
job.promotion_speech: I guess you've proven yourself enough for a promotion. Don't make me regret my decision.

random_event.description: Ouch. Your shoulders are burning from those Military Presses.
12 sets on the bench. Maybe you're pushing a little to hard...
You smashed the heavy bag for 5 rounds.
Shake weight class went awesome.
1000 Sit-ups! Holy &%$#!
You ran a marathon on the treadmill. Give yourself a pat on the back.
Kicked it up a notch during Jujitsu class. You tapped everyone out.
Kickboxing cardio workout. It almost broke you.
Jim shared his secret stash of advanced work out VHS tapes. Now you just need a VCR!

job.hired_speech: Welcome to the U of SA.
job.not_eligible_speech: Why don't you ask a homeless guy if can hold his change cup? We've got low standards, but you don't meet 'em.
job.no_promotion_speech: There are no promotions, you're at school n00b.
job.promotion_speech: I guess you've proven yourself enough for a promotion. Don't make me regret my decision.

random_event.description: Your class worked on an artificial intelligence that may someday rule the world.
Your computer programming class went well. So did the flash game you were playing the entire time.
Just another day of Histopathology. This stuff is almost to easy.
Multivariate Statistics class again. Boring.
You Learned a whole bunch of 'technical stuff'.
Group self-evaluation scores are in. Your group liked you, apparently.
Your Intelligence stat has been raised 22 points for being such a good student.
You aced the exam! Time to par-tay!

general.speech: "I'm gonna do it! I'm gonna jump!! Man, I wish I had a bottle of painkillers... I wanna leave a beautiful corpse instead of tossing it off the edge where no one can find me. Stay back, man!"

quest.speech: "I'm gonna do it! I'm gonna jump!! ...Man, I wish I had a bottle of painkillers. I wanna leave a beautiful corpse instead of tossing it off the edge where no one can find me."
quest.reward_speech: "What? This isn't what I asked for... you.. want to help me? Maybe I will give this a read before I off myself. Take this squeegee I found, may it be of use."
quest.follow_up_speech: "Thanks dude, this book is going to totally change my outlook on life."
quest.active_speech: "Find any painkillers yet?? Stay back!!"

quest.speech: "I'm gonna do it! I'm gonna jump!! ...Man, I wish I had a bottle of painkillers. I wanna leave a beautiful corpse instead of tossing it off the edge where no one can find me."
quest.reward_speech: "Thanks! I snatched some kids squeegee earlier - take it. Oh, and have the rest of my cash. I'm not gonna need it where I'm going..."
quest.follow_up_speech: "Thanks again for the pills. I promise not to haunt you when I cross over to the other side. Haha. Ha. Yeah."
quest.active_speech: "Find any painkillers yet?? Stay back!!"

general.speech: "I had an interview once for a job as an ice cream taster. When I showed up at the abandoned pier for my interview, some kids punched me in the face and took my wallet and, you know what, the interviewer never showed up either. Which is too bad, really, because the job sounded like it would have paid pretty well."
"These tinfoil socks? I wear them so that the government can't track me. SHHHHH--SHUUSH UP BE QUIET!! Did you hear that? They're close... so close..."
"Most people know that each time a bell rings, an angel gets its wings.... but what they don't know is that each time a baby cries, an angel sets on fire."

"Wasn't like this on mars... no sir no WAY! Back then, the golden years of NHI, us miners were unionized. Yesiree, 5 coffee breaks and a three-hour lunch, and TWO lunches on Wednesday, Thursdays, Tuesdays, Mondays, Fridays and Thursdays. That was, fore ol Natas, with his laser eye monocle and what-not, went off the deep end. Ya' see, the drop in Goldium prices got ol Natas all fretful and apprehensive... that's when the pressure got to me... you know you'da done the same... you'da showed him too... showed him what he had coming...*unintelligible muttering* heehhee... yeah.... got you good Natas... got you REAL good...hehe..." *The homeless man trails off*
*The homeless man is talking to himself* "What? I'm not putting words in your mouth! If I wanted to put words in your mouth, I'd write them down on a piece of paper and shove them in your mouth!"

"I brainwashed them to march at dawn in minuscule but growing numbers, dispatched by the sound of drums. I indoctrinated their minds with a single obsession; the methodical, robotic destruction of any castle in their path with the pounding of their fists. I created an evil, barbaric force of mindless monsters! HA! An unstoppable army!! Ha-HA! Just try and stop them!!! HAHAHA! MWAHAHAHAHAH!!! *The homeless man laughs maniacally while frothing at the mouth and rocking back and forth*"

"After the SAT's, my high-school guidance counselor told me I have the psychological profile of a clown-puncher, but the aptitude of an ass hat. I guess there were a lot of layoffs during the recession, because I never see openings for either job in the paper."
"I need a 40 like a fat kid needs cake."

quest.speech: "Dude, what happened to the last set of wheels I gave you? Whatever, I guess that was in the 2D world... just bring me a XXX Video this time and I'll give you my new skateboard."
quest.reward_speech: "Sweetness! Here dude - enjoy it, it's completely custom."
quest.follow_up_speech: "I hope you're not here to tell me you lost the skateboard again."
quest.active_speech: "Got that XXX Video yet?? Hurry up! At this rate, I'll turn legal and buy it myself before you get it for me!"
quest.have_not_speech: "Nice try, dude. I know I'm just a kid, but I'm not stupid. You're not getting this board until I get that video."
quest.action: "Aren't you supposed to be in school right now?"

general.speech: "Hey sugar... looking for a good time?"
"They call me the Coca Nut Cowboy. You got something for me?"

quest.speech: "They call me the Coca Nut Cowboy. You got something for me?"
quest.reward_speech: "Easy peazy, lemon squeezy. Pleasure doing business."
quest.follow_up_speech: "You get any more, you know where I'll be."
quest.active_speech: "They call me the Coca Nut Cowboy; you got something for me?"
quest.dismiss_speech: "I'll be the judge of that. You don't want to do business, then $%#& off."

quest.speech: "They call me the Coca Nut Cowboy. You got something for me?"
quest.reward_speech: *Singing* "...and I'm wanted...Dead or Alive!"
quest.follow_up_speech: "You any get more, you know where I'll be."
quest.active_speech: "They call me the Coca Nut Cowboy; you got something for me?"
quest.action: "Not right now, I'll be back later."

quest.speech: "They call me the Coca Nut Cowboy. You got something for me?"
quest.reward_speech:
*Snort* "Hey 'bro, ain't got no more cash man. But I heard you need some 4D #$%& to get home. I found this mobius strip while I was on cloud 9. *Sniff* It's... all.. yourrrssss..."
(The Coca Nut Cowboy goes into overdose-induced cardiac arrest)
quest.active_speech: "They call me the Coca Nut Cowboy; you got something for me?"

quest.speech: "See that boxing glove?! Lets take this outside Brochacho."
quest.reward_speech: "Ima' go home and sleep it off"
quest.active_speech: "Hello occifer? No, I’m not drinking this evening, occifer... are yoooo calling me a liar? I’m not argumenting, YOU'RE argumenting... (The man's drunkolog continues.)"

general.speech: "If I'da 'ad the day off I'da threw on me boardies and me sunnies and 'eaded down to the beach, I woulda'. 'ats the way of it though, it's me lot in life."
"The next time I 'ear an Aussie wise-crack about tha' Croc Hunter or dingoes or Mr. Dundeee, I'm gunna' ride my kango' over the lad's face an' give 'im tha' boot!"
*The song 'Land Down Under' is faintly audible from the headphones around the barkeep's neck* Now, what'll it be?
"These pretzels... are making me thirsty."
*Burp*

quest.active_speech: "Psst... you got to help get me out of here! My fortune has been sized due to my current incarceration. I just need $10,000 to post bail and I promise to send you half of the $63,000,000,000,000,000 I can then access from my Swiss bank account."
quest.dismiss_speech: "Please! My country and my people need me!"

general.speech: "Salutations and greetings, sir. I have heard rumor of 4 rare 'Trophemon' making their way here, into Paper Thin City. I must have them to complete my collection! Find them for me and I shall pay you handsomely for your efforts."

general.speech: "Hey, we're rallying to save the Trophemon birds that have taken up home here in Paper Thin City."

"Oh yea bro, I'm a total animal snacktivist... or is it activist? Man I have the munchies..."
"Save the birds, eh!"
"No doot aboot it."
"My cat! She's stuck up in that tree. Poor thing... please, help me! Somebody help me!"

quest.speech: "My cat! She's stuck up in that tree. Poor dear... Please, help me?! Somebody help me!"
quest.reward_speech: "Lord, thank-you! My precious is alive! Goodness gracious, it looked like she was after some kind of bird that was hiding in that tree..."
quest.follow_up_speech: "Bless your heart."
quest.active_speech: "Hurry... please hurry!"

general.speech: "Chickitty check yo' self before you wriggedy wreck yo' self, playa."

"A lot of folks in town are in need just waiting for a hero to come alone."

quest.speech: "Whoa, that was some fall! You must have just come from the 2nd dimension, am I right? This here is the 2.5D world, so things look a little different but - as with all parallel universes - things are kind of similar, too. I know it's a lot to take in, but you're stuck here in Paper Thin City till you find a way home."
quest.reward_speech: "Looks that way. Well, I suppose you have to start somewhere -- here, take this key. You can stay in my basement till you get your bearings; it's the building right behind me. Oh, and here's a couple bucks to start you off. Talk to me again if you want to know more."
quest.evil_reward_speech: "Well, even the ungrateful need a place to stay. Take this key, you can stay in my basement behind me here. Oh, and here's a couple bucks to feed that dirty mouth of yours."
quest.follow_up_speech: "Go talk to that green headed guy if you want some more info."
quest.evil_follow_up_speech: "Well, even the ungrateful need a place to stay. Take this key, you can stay in my basement behind me here. Oh, and here's a couple bucks to feed that dirty mouth of yours."
quest.active_speech: "Active speech"

quest.speech: "The only advice I can give you would be to find Professor Ansel. He was running some strange research lab but now he teaches over at the university. He knows a thing or two about all this 'dimensional' business."
quest.reward_speech: "Goodbye friend, and good luck out there."
quest.evil_reward_speech: "The hell with you then. I tried to be nice."
quest.follow_up_speech: "Go find Professor Ansel"
quest.evil_follow_up_speech: "The hell with you then. I tried to be nice. You can figure this game out on your own!"
quest.active_speech: "Are you gonna help me out with some cash or not?"
quest.have_not_speech: "Is this supposed to be a cruel joke? I don't need pocket lint, I need cash!"
quest.dismiss_speech: "No one's got a gun to your head."

quest.speech: "Call me Ishmael. Some years ago -- never mind how long precisely -- having little or no money in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me on shore, I thought I would sail about a little and see the watery part of the world. It is a way I have of driving off the spleen, and regulating the circulation. Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul; whenever I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses, and bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever my hypos get such an upper hand of me, that it requires a strong moral principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street, and methodically knocking people's hats off -- then, I account it high time to get to sea as soon as I can."
quest.reward_speech: "This is my substitute for pistol and ball. With a philosophical flourish Cato throws himself upon his sword; I quietly take to the ship. There is nothing surprising in this. If they but knew it, almost all men in their degree, some time or other, cherish very nearly the same feelings toward the ocean with me."

"Women are like wolves. If you want one you must trap it. Snare it. Tame it. Feed it..."
"I am faster than 80% of all snakes."
"Oh, I steal things all the time. It's just something I do. I stopped trying a long time ago. You should see how many supplies I've taken from this place. Honestly, I love stealing things."

"Oh, I steal things all the time. It's just something I do. I stopped trying a long time ago. You should see how many supplies I've taken from this place. Honestly, I love stealing things"

"I think Bigfoot is blurry, that's the problem. It's not the photographer's fault. Bigfoot is blurry, and that's extra scary to me. There's a large, out-of-focus monster roaming the countryside. Run, he's fuzzy, get out of here!"
"I'm against picketing, but I don't know how to show it."
"My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them."

"I want to hang a map of the world in my house, and then I’m gonna put pins into all the locations that I've travelled to. But first I'm gonna have to travel to the top two corners of the map so it won't fall down."
"I order the club sandwich all the time, but I'm not even a member, man. I don't know how I get away with it."

"I was in a casino, minding my own business, and this guy came up to me and said, 'You're gonna have to move. You're blocking a fire exit.' As though if there was a fire, I wasn't gonna run. If you're flammable and have legs you are never blocking a fire exit. Unless you're a table."
"Ya, I got a job.... but it's only for the baddest dudes around. Someone has to take care of the kitten infestation problem around here."
*Snore*
"Hey there Sonny.... how YOU doin?"
"I sure could go for a skinny dip right about now..."

general.speech: "Gimme' a pack of smokes."
"You got a problem, pal?"
"You're lucky they have cameras in here."
"Check it -- I got some helpful hints for noobs like you. First of all, you can hold down the 'Shift' key to run (or skateboard, if you have one). Keep talking to me to learn more."
"You need more strength, charm and intelligence if you want to get anywhere here in Paper Thin City. You can increase your Strength by hitting the gym or by fighting."
"Need more charm? Go get drunk. Easy. The University is a great place to work on your Intelligence, and it has a gym too."

"The days here are divided into 4 segments -- "
Morning is 4:00am - 10:00am
Afternoon is 10:00am - 4:00pm
Evening is 4:00pm - 11:00pm
Night is 11:00pm - 4:00am
"You need to catch some Z's when it gets too late. You have that key from Ted, right? You can sleep in the basement suite."
"Guys with a 'boxing glove' chat bubble want to punch you in the face. Be careful who you talk to. If you get beat up they will take your cash. Protect your flow, bank it Bro."
"You need ID if you want into the 'happening' parts of the city. Rudy can help you out; he's usually out by 11-7 at night. You can also swing by the police station to pick up an ID card."
"Girls aren't easy to catch around here -- they only date guys with high stats, if you know what I mean."
"You don't want to live in a basement forever. You can buy real estate from the bank, using the bank machine. You can also deposit funds here for safekeeping."
"Well, that's all I've got for now. Good luck on your journey, it's sure to be a doozy."
"Let me repeat that for you, in case you missed something."

"This one has less salt."

"This one has less fat."

"From the shadows..."

"Well, hello darling! It's a pleasure to meet you! I have heard so much about the new bachelor in town. So tell me, do you want the low down on who is 'available' in Paper Thin? I have all the info on the single ladies around town."
"Tiffany is single. Tragically, her last boyfriend cheated on her. She's a girl that likes a man with some muscle, so you better hit the gym if you want to impress her."
"If you like bad-girls, you should look up Devin. She's into everything that's wrong with this world, if you ask me. But hey, she IS single."

"If you're more of a bookworm-type, you can always try to impress Kate. She spends most of her time reading, writing and going to school. She's a real straight shooter, but I hear she's looking for a man in her life."
"If you have the money, Victoria is easily impressed by a large wallet. She is usually wondering around in the Benjamins Club."
"That is about all of them for the moment. I will let you know if any more ladies become available."

"Vinnie is one bad dude, man. That guy... you don't want to mess with."
"The sewer people are sure getting braver. You never use to see them, but I saw another one just yesterday. It's just a matter of time before someone gets attacked. They're crazed I tell ya."

"The city has been hit with some big time problems as of late. I'm working with the Jebediah Council to figure out some solutions. Right now, the sewer people are our number one concern."
